column4: Does anybody know how i could find the password of my forgotten pass account?
I have tryed both the shadow file AND the passwd file, no luck.
I have also tryed John the Ripper
No luck
Does anybody know how i could find my other user's password on my ubuntu 10.10 netbook?
No.
That isn't my idea
I want to see how easy it is to really find it, and if it's possible.
is it possible to figure out another users password in ubuntu?
syberia, this is a new computer, but i forgot what i set the password as... so i made a new admin account
Password hashes are stored in /etc/shadow. They're hashed with SHA-256 on Ubuntu 10.10, if memory serves. Assuming a strong password, reversing this hash is computationally infeasible.
but i actully want to know (out of curiosity) what it is.
looks like SHA-512 on this system, so even less feasible.
i know it is SHA-512 due to the $6$ in front of the encryption
indeed.
is it possible at all that if i send you the shadow, u could find the pass?
mathematically possible or practically possible?
I mean, theoretically, I could punch random letters in and find it on the first try. But practically, as I said, if it's a reasonably strong password then no.
please acept file transfer.
no
I appoligize for wasting your time.
